alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 2:54AM EDT until April 07 at 10:41PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...Georgia... Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 12.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 13.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
